FZtI7buGujEqDVl6IYB6bA.text: We had an absolutely great brunch.  The French toast was fantastic and the fish tacos we also delicious.  They have endless beer options and great appetizers the pretzel bites with beer cheese were the best I've ever had.  I will definitely be back every time I have time to kill in downtown.  The place is busy but worth the wait.

AlRbBVb6-7TchhTMAC-HoA.text: Beer selection is very impressive! Food was good overall. The service was great! Location, Location, Location. We had a blast.... twice!

59UstjGOKazHwHnHBnkPDw.text: Worst service in the Square. Interior atmosphere nice but doesn't do me any good if I can't get a drink or the MLB game they promised me.

LcPdsk7gvQpqUIPDg_c3iA.text: It's a shame that a restaurant with such a great location in market square let me down. It took us about an hour and a half to be seated (there were many parties who checked in after us, without a reservation I might add, who were seated before us). Once we were seated, we were seated at a dirty table,service was slow (took about 45 minutes to get my drink) and food wasn't worth what we paid for it.   Next time I am in Pittsburgh I won't be coming back. Too poor of an experience IMO.

y7UITs9t-fo_oeIvM5nL-A.text: DO NOT ORDER THE FILET MIGNON SLIDERS.  While they sound and even look appetizing, they are terrible especially considering the price.  The meat is chewy and dry.  Really wish this place would get consistent with their food because the atmosphere is so fun.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chewy and dry filet sliders.  Avoid at all costs.
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. What is supposed to be buffalo chicken dip

9WVXrUi6X4kogap-4jCPYg.text: This place looked like it had a lot of potential. Not sure if it was because the NBA Playoffs were on when we were in there, but it was very disappointing.  The place is very large. Lots of seating (indoor and outdoor). The place was mostly empty and there were about 15 tables with people at them and a handful at the bar. We were seated towards the back of the restaurant near the window. Not sure why because we ended up by ourselves.  Finally we had a server come to our table and we ordered our drinks and food. The beers came out, no problem. But the pretzel bites with cheese, were forgotten. We waited and waited and finally went up to someone near the bar to figure out what was going on and we found out that they never put the order in. Someone from management apologized and brought us out an order finally, but, they were dry and the cheese was clumpy. All that wait for nothing. Meanwhile, the workers were mostly standing around watching the basketball game.

CE9cwIukalOAnG3ItC3ZWg.text: Just had lunch here and must say the Smoked Chicken Wings were fire!!! It is the closest to a grilled chicken wing I have had since living downtown and took me back to cookouts at my parents.  Also, I had a guiness because you know, everyone is Irish this weekend.  All in all another fantastic experience.

ls7hGWCn9BKXIUG-d6F-XQ.text: Always just okay, noting special. The restaurant looks great inside. They spent the time and money to fix it up but food isn't fantastic. This is my 3rd time here and feel the same. Happy hour is ok 4-6 but waiter didn't come around for last call, or the last 20 mins really  Some drinks are expensive, $11 for a glass of wine. Wouldn't suggest getting the offer on Spring rewards. It is NOT like Groupon. You pay $5, then only have one month to visit and pay another $15 to get $15 back. I've had the burger, ribs, poutine fries (frozen), fish, and all are mediocre. Service has always been decent. They will not do any substitutions, which is a big turn off! If you don't like a side you are given, you are out of luck! The "chef" will not do anything than what's on the menu. They would not even make a regular chicken sandwich. I don't think we'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

i8vBTDQBDwIwXMDnBwnXRg.text: Lots of TVs, great beers and comfy booths.  Those are reasons to come. Here are some reasons not to: 1.  High drink prices 2.  Loud (they haven't EQ'd any of the TV audio...so basketball for example is this horrendous squeak-fest as sneakers of players are over-amplified and pumped over dozens of cheap speakers...it is truly abhorrent). 3.  Mostly lousy food and store-bought desserts 4.  Overall, dining room and bathrooms are pretty dirty and not attended to.  Loud, expensive and food lacking.  My advice: come at a less busy time, sit as far as possible from speakers...and try to ignore the grunge as you sample the nice beer selections.

ggEh0vNUo5qP92iyxQTpfA.text: Awesome experience. Very busy night around town but we were seated in less than 15 min. Started with buffalo shrimp which were excellent. My wife had tuna tacos (pictured) which were excellent and I had the grouper which was excellent as well. Perfect service too. We would recommend, esp considering the other close by choices, blows them away.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LMqB2n4PROSldt3bJvYd9A.text: City Works was much better than I expected. Went for happy hour on a Friday. Although it was packed there were still plenty of tables to sit. There are over 90 beers on tap, so a ton to choose from and they are $4 during happy hour.  I found the food to be a bit pricey. I paid $15 for shrimp tacos. If they weren't so good I would complain more about the price. Our waitress was super friendly and quick. We did not all arrive at once so every time another person in our party came she came right over.  There are parking garages all around. Next time I will park a bit closer. I was in a garage on the blvd of the allies. My other friends parked at Golds gym.  I will be back.

wyeI6xYxZNrjMr8u1Tha_w.text: Came here for a social event. It was pretty good, I ordered the salmon as my entree. I love the whole presentation and the delicious veggies that came with it. They did not use too much oil like a lot of restaurants when they cook veggies, it was just right. Salmon was seasoned perfectly and tasted pretty fresh. My boyfriend got the shrimp tacos and he shared one w me. I love it a lot! Everyone at the event seems to enjoy their food. There are a lot of appetizers that seem very appetizing to me, I want to come back to try those next time. Overall, it was a pretty solid experience for me.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZCD9Mu_jRE6rcX9GwsQlaA.text: I've come here a couple times for drinks and watch sports games. This place is definitely a sports bar. I can't speak to their food but they have an awesome selection of beer. Dozens of beers on tap. Dozens of TVs to watch on. My fiance really wanted to watch the World Cup soccer game with sound and the hostess was very accommodating and allowed us to watch the game with the sound on in a separate room. I'll definitely continue coming here for drinks/games.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GEwe22drMUjMp9uk2wEwZA.text: As far as a place to have a drink and watch a game - 5 stars! The venue is AWESOME. Tons of big tvs, plenty of space and a unique seating structure. Unfortunately, I wasn't at City Works to watch a game, I was there for dinner - fish tacos to be specific. Between my overcooked and chewy fish tacos and my husband's underwhelming ribs, I can't say I'm a fan of the food at CW, but I do truly enjoy the ambiance and will be back for drinks again someday.

gttQ2qn4skRz5kcXD4sb6A.text: Four stars because it's good, the happy hour is decent, but you never know what you're going to get service wise. Is your server having a bad day and can't be bothered to give a shit about their customers? Or do you get a seasoned professional? Literally you don't know until you sit down. But it's a fun atmosphere, especially on game days and their chicken firecracker rolls are dope.

35ZBelrPw_fkeqYunRDg_A.text: My wife and I went there on Friday night.  They had a good crowd but there were plenty of seats.  We told the server we had two so she sat out two menus and from there on ignored us.  A man came in behind us and said he had four (only for drinks) that just wanted to sit outside and she went with him.  We stood there for a couple more minutes and then decided to leave.  Even as we left, she didn't say anything to us.  We went right up the street and got a good meal at Wingharts.

ijQKIvCAOf0Jk--WsYzD9A.text: Came into town for business and this place was across from my hotel. For being a chain, the food was amazing and the beer on tap selection was incredible. Would absolutely recommend.

TIM564hbHFkaEoESStC2Mw.text: So I made a reservation with city works via email NOT open table for a Saturday night for my birthday. I arrive and I'm told open table shouldn't have let me reserve on a weekend. I never went though open table I contacted city works directly and showed them the email. The manager talked to me and honestly by his demeanor I felt like he could care less, he was rude and cold and a times like it wasn't on him to accommodate! However the host and hostess were great and accommodating they got a us a table made us first priority. The manager did comp our first drinks and some appetizers. The food and service were great. If it wasn't for the great host , hostess and waiter. This would've been a 1 star review based on a manger who acted like I didn't book directly with the restaurant and blames on an employee who happened to be off when we were there.

SfRkLq1T5SPqQJQ-g3zzWw.text: We waited quite a long time for a table even though there were plenty of empty tables. The waitress appeared to be unhappy in her job and it took her a half hour to finally come to take our order. The food took over an hour to come to the table and it was not good at all. The Carolina chicken is terrible. Not one of us will return.

tkrd4FnA9VAwIeGihazAFQ.text: Place looks new and is very nice and clean. That is the 1 star. It took close to 20 minutes for my wife to finally get a wine after they were out of the 1st one she ordered. We ordered the short rib poutine. Fries were under cooked and that was the good part of the app. There is no way the meat in the dish was short rib. It was the worst meat I have ever tired to eat.

D64owNBrIaxqKzIlZV4NwA.text: Right around the corner from my workplace, Cityworks fits the bill for that team lunch or work happy hour that really isn't much about the food or drinks but a checkbox that mandates your attendance despite that. I can't see myself picking it for any other reason besides proximity to work! It's not that I've had a terrible experience but nothing really stood out for me. I don't particularly like being squashed into their awkward semicircular booths. Somehow our party of 6 always finds itself in one of these semicircular booths. Their cocktails are ok - nothing memorable. They've limited vegetarian options so I usually get their wild mushroom bread which has been wildly inconsistent in terms of flavor. I liked it the first time but the last time it was a bit burnt and almost crunchy tostada like. Service is polite but on the past two occasions I was there, they mixed up orders. So all in all - Meh!

G4rhGUOuGwIfa-hf0Kk9DQ.text: I have been here twice and both times it was disappointing to say the least.  Both time they messed up the orders of people in our party and those that did get the correct order were not pleased with the quailty.

LHzrct28IsUSVJ9Kx3X2Yw.text: The bar service was wonderful, however when we got to our table it wasn't quite the same. As I've been reading the food seems pretty good, which we were excited for, but we never received ours. When we talked to our server he didn't even realize or care that he had forgotten our order. A few of the drinks were not delivered correctly either. My friends and I would love to come back and give this place another try, but the service and attitude we received definitely left us with a sour feeling.

B6ozhNULZ1auaYdBmoLQ2w.text: Great location and beer selection!  Food was above average, but a little pricey.  Great meeting place

DsK8iTdrtx4y93Zt4LXxiw.text: Great first experience at a City Works restaurant. Our server, Keith, was extremely upbeat, knowledgeable, and fun. The wait staff influenced our dining experience in a great way and made this first time-visit to Pittsburg, a memorable one. #keith

Yi8ds2QCq6_S4lgq0f0gdw.text: I was there lastnight/evening my friend got a jack and coke ($10) and after drinking it we noticed something odd in the glass we dumped it out and it was someone's fake FINGERNAIL!! We mentioned it to the bartender and she kinda laughed about it and offers free drink!! We also told the manager on duty and he said "sorry there's nothing I can do"  DRINKERS BEWARE  bottles only for me if I ever go back

kdi7bZ__s_-kR7Sj7MkFug.text: I went here on a Sunday evening on a recommendation from a friend who told me to go when it's not crowded because their service wasn't the best. I walked in and there were several open tables and many open seats at the bar. There was no one on either side of me, yet it took them 10 minutes just to ask if I wanted a drink. After that, it took them 12 minutes to pour a cider. When I ordered the Carolina Fried Chicken sandwich, it took 33 minutes for me to get it. On a Sunday evening when it wasn't crowded. I never give a bad reviews, but this was ridiculous. Two stars because the sandwich was delicious.

856JJRFqe_UlkyTUysqleg.text: I'll keep it simple. Great beer menu. Terrible food. We had two beers, an appetizer, a burger and a sandwich. $65. The burger was the perfectly shaped patty that screamed premade/frozen. The buffalo chicken dip was barely warm. Probably awesome for happy hour but don't stay for dinner.

FgCzTJN_BnJzxVjUcYiiRQ.text: service WACK. shrimp WACK. servers WACK. ummmm i don't think i'll come back but give it a try if you want

NvpYQ0CUInRhHixE7Uhp7A.text: Was here for March madness last weekend.... crazy!   Big ol tvs with the games on and music and funny you tube videos playing in the background.   I got a flight of sweet baby Jesus,  banana bread beer, Neapolitan stout,  and bumble berry....soooooo good.  Pretty big flight too, I was feeling it.    Anyhow,  I ate before I got there so I didn't really eat but i did try the pretzel bite things with beer cheese of course.   They have 90 beers there,  all different.... You can see I made my own little categorized flight.... which was bomb.   But the place is just fun... oh... and I had a wing,  which was amazing,  smoky and yummy.  Anyhow,  market square needed some spot like this...check it out, you'll dig it.

5CUrZ-O0Wj3pgJIXL46qOw.text: Food is mediocre.  Service was ok.  One positive note is that they had a great beer selection.  Would only come again for a happy hour, not for dinner.

I-fF9zyuYE4NT9EHy4pFgA.text: This spot is a great place to schedule a meet up with friends, which is exactly what I did. Nice drink selection and they have plenty of space. We stayed a while and we weren't rushed whatsoever. Parking of course is not that great because it's in downtown. Worth the visit if you want a laid back in house extensive food and drink selection. Service was wonderful as well.

xC5WrO1k_IyvMyjCLFLL2Q.text: Slow service. Went for lunch on a Wednesday. Waited 40 minutes for 4 identical salads and 2 sandwiches. CityWorks salad was OK - chicken was a bit dry and under seasoned. Fried chicken sandwich and filet sliders were good.   Even though our server acknowledged the food took a long time and was aware of our time crunch, she was slow in getting and processing our checks.

sn9yTX9qpxT4G7EWLNgXqQ.text: City Works is a very sub par within Pittsburgh. It is incredibly mismanaged. I have worked in ppg place for 10 years and was excited for a new happy hour and event location. Every time I have gone here which has been about 10 times, I have been disappointed. It is so close to my work I continue to give it a chance. I scheduled a team event with 25 people and they called two days before and said they couldn't accommodate us and had to fire their event manager...unprofessional. We made it work by going very early but come on. I went to happy hour at 3:45 and the hostess asked us if we were staying for happy hour which started at 4. Also asked if we all needed seats. The place was absolutely empty. They have a great location and beautiful facility. They need to get it together.

-lPMdTHRpNBUAaprzhjM9Q.text: Every time I'm here it takes the server extremely long to initially come over for drink orders. There is never any check in throughout my dining experience either. I use the establishment for business frequently, but am embarrassed to bring new people here because of the poor service. I'll be looking for new places to entertain.

ATXCr4Vtc3pWDM5TADwbGw.text: Stopped into this place for some quick apps. We got the duck nachos, cheese curds, and firecracker rolls. The nachos were spot on and the highlight of the meal. The cheese curds were lack luster but we had high expectations being from Wisconsin. The firecracker rolls were pretty good and filling too. We thought it was pretty fair prices but nothing exceptional. This place was recently opened so they have some service issues to figure out but they were really attentive and tried to make up for it.

TXtvFYi7l8lMG-_023bOXQ.text: The kind of large, soulless box I expect to find in the suburbs or the new Bldgs on the north shore. Very sad. 10 video monitors per patron, zero personality cavern. There may be a time and place for such an establishment but for it to be allowed to take a large prime spot is Market Square, which is characterized by charm and unique establishments, is a disappointing at best. If all you want is mediocre food and beer with 3,000 video screens to distract you from your human company and an environment with no warmth or character, you found it. Downtown Pittsburgh rapid growth - slow down - you can do much better.  This one is a shame.

1mqszBYvaW4lI96-USFAVg.text: Nice upscale new sports bar in Pittsburgh's always electric Market Square. The building is huge with a lot of seating both indoors and out. Great spot to watch a game as there are massive tv's everywhere. The menu wasn't as large as I expected so I was kind of limited on options. I got a bacon cheeseburger which was cooked to my liking and overall pretty good. My buddy got an order of the smoked wings and they were outstanding. The wings come with 2 different BBQ sauces, 1 spicy and 1 sweet, both are ridiculously good. Another member of our party got buffalo shrimp and raved about it. City Works has a huge beer selection that we were all pleased with. The service left a lot to be desired (slow, forgot drinks) but I can't really hold that against them as it's only been open a month or so and it was a Pens playoff game. All in all, pretty good spot with decent food and beer.

5gjZKQqJuC4iuoEbqJn90A.text: Came in for some beers and snacks at happy hour and are looking forward to going back.   The draft list is impressive to say the least. 90 beers on tap with a large percentage of local and PA drafts. (East End, Church, Drai Laag, Grist House, etc) with every style pretty well represented.   We had the cheese curds (happy hour special) and the duck confit nachos. Both were excellent with generous portions. The nachos were on fried wontons which was a unique presentation that worked very well.   The restaurant was not busy while we were there but the service was incredible. The host was attentive and sat us quickly, our server was friendly and knowledgeable, and as soon as a plate or glass was empty the next employee to walk by asked if they could clear it.   Cannot wait to go back and try more of the menu and the silly awesome beer list.

Tt549tzBlcJ0-gnk67MUow.text: PROS: Big space with lots of tables that would probably be good for large groups. There are a ton of TVs above the bar as well as scattered throughout the restaurant, so you won't miss any of the local games. Huge beer selection. Decent (if overpriced) appetizers. Service was pretty attentive except for when our waitress stepped out for a smoke.  CONS: Watch out for the prices. A friend was in town and we both had a tulip glass of Arsenal Picket Bone Dry cider, which is a local cider. They were $13 each, so we'd spent $26 on our first two drinks, which is more than the fancy cocktails cost. In their defense, the price was listed on the menu, but the since this is a local cider that retails for (~$6/glass at the Arsenal Cider House less than 3miles away, I was shocked at the price-gouging). The appetizer that I'd ordered (jalepeno poppers) were good if slightly overpriced. I also had a salad entree which was abundant and tasty. All told, I received a bill for $70 for the aforementioned cider, 3 beers, one appetizer, and one entree salad.   SUMMARY: I'd recommend this place if you've got a large group and someone else is footing the bill, but smaller groups might be inclined to look elsewhere.

jGUzzO0sAf7x2_dnWimzEw.text: Great experience at a great new spot! We came during happy hour and had half off appetizers so we got the buffalo chicken dip and pretzels with beer cheese. Both were pretty good for restaurant quality food but then I was blown away by the filet mignon sliders. They were cooked exactly the way I ordered and had a lot of flavor. The horseradish sauce was a little light, but too much might have overpowered the flavor of the meat. The fries were also good and complemented the meal well. Very trendy vibe in the restaurant and the decor was very classy. There were lots of great options on the menu and it was so hard to decide but our waitress was very helpful in recommending several dishes! Throughout the meal she was also very attentive and made sure that we had a great experience! Can't wait to return soon and try something new!!

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet Minton sliders

HJOALNfbU6TfAVhVBKG9Wg.text: Wanted drinks and dessert with friends. Stopped here and had a great selection of beers. 3 desserts on menu. Nothing Gluten Free. ?? Asked for ice cream and was told they couldn't sell it by itself. Really?

VLDYs4vVQQvzp_4ukaTc0w.text: This place was a major disappointment. Went there for a work dinner the other night and while the atmosphere was great for a sports bar the food was poor and overpriced. My friend had fish tacos and she said they were fine but they looked like something I would make in my kitchen with frozen fish sticks. I had a burger and ordered it medium. It came out well done with grey meat and rubbery texture. It boasted homemade onion straws...BAD IDEA! They were undercooked and stringy. I could not even bite through them so I had to take them all off just to be able to eat the sandwich. It was like eating a burger with dental floss. If you go there, go for a beer and the TV set up. Skip the food!

zHwDUzQeBSjnA4JM8rMaMg.text: I had a great experience at City Works. It was a busy Friday night and we maybe only have to wait 10 minutes for a table without making reservations. We grabbed a drink at the bar while we waited. The bartender got to us immediately. Before he even could make it back with our drinks, we were approached by another bartender. Clearly, the bartenders are great at high volume. The hostess that sat us was very pleasant. She even made a cute joke as we walked to the table saying, "the busser is still clearing your table so we're just going to walk really slow".   We sat down and were immediately greeted. The best part of the evening was our server. Her name was Hunter and she was exactly the type of server I love. I don't like the "server voice" (when their tone goes up two octaves when they speak). She got to the point and asked if I needed another drink. The more important priority! We ordered drinks and an appetizer. None of which took long or at least I though. I didn't feel rushed and got to enjoy the experience. She was efficient and not over barring. Empty glasses were removed before i even noticed. Quite stealth and appreciated.   The food was good. We shared the pretzel bites and I got the ahi salad. The cheese sauce was delicious. My salad was good. A little spicier than I'm used to for tuna, but I wasn't complaining. Took half home for later, so it was a good portion. And for downtown Pittsburgh, the price was more than reasonable.   When we were almost done, Hunter came over and apologized for our food taking so long. She said it was her fault for waiting too long in between courses. Honestly, I didn't even notice. They were busy and we were being taken care of so well that I couldn't feel impatient. Not everything has to be fast food service. I also give her some respect for owning up to her mistake and taking responsibility for it. Most servers would blame the kitchen or the crowd. But seriously, it didn't bother us at all.   I liked the open dining area and loved all the windows. Great for people watching. There were also TVs if you wanted to watch the game. But this definitely wasn't geared to just a sports crowd. The bathrooms were clean and private, especially for being such a busy night.   I had a great time and plan to go back and recommend this place to my friends!   I hope management actually reads this. I want to give major credit to the personable, knowledgeable, efficient, and attentive server we had. Thank you!

PoApt04GdUTcA4EpgTg0OQ.text: Went here after the steelers home opener. Quickly seated, and the place was packed. Great place to warch the games. We ordered nachos, and deep fried pickles to start. Nachos were standard, and the pickles were thinly sized which was different but delicious. Impossible burger was great as advertised. Options for Vegans and meat lovers. Our server was top notch.

Sip7wT9fzVbK1YhXuk_0Vg.text: Where should I start.  Probably the worst restaurant experience I have had in the city of Pittsburgh.  First of all our soup,  salad,  appetizer,  and entree all came out at the same time.  Then my girlfriends salad was supposed to be a BBQ chicken salad and was far from it.  So they took that same exact salad into the back and added onion rings in an attempt to make it the salad she wanted.  It was still the wrong salad.  Now it was the wrong salad with onion rings on top.  So the bartender took it into the back again and we waited for drink refills for 10 min.  It turns out our drink service was lousy for 10 minutes because he decided to stay in the back and  eat the salad. It gets better, he then walked out from the back with salad plate in hand just chomping away while STILL not refilling our beverages. It was hard to believe our eyes.   Next I got a sub par Thai chicken wrap.  It came with stale tortilla chips instead of the fries.  And when we commented on their lousy service and overall experience,  the bartender ignored us for refills,  again.  Like we did something wrong.  The manager didn't take care of anything and actually hid from us as we left.  Thanks Allen,  for the help.  So we went to 5 guys for burgers after wasting $64.00 of my hard earned money.  Do yourself a favor and pick a different restaurant at market square Unless you feel like paying to eat a second dinner. However,  since they get one star I will mention a positive.  They have a great beer selection and lots of TVs.  That's about it.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Where are the fries?  This wasn&#39;t even an option.

Ngi9b2h8WMxjWT8AmhL37w.text: Awful experience both times I've been there. Overcrowded, horrible service. Unless you enjoy waiting twenty minutes to get a beer, go to one of the other bars in market square.

dILFak6noemR8qCxabePPQ.text: The service and management are terrible.  Waiting on a Saturday afternoon I've never seen so many open tables with so many people waiting to be seated.  Then when we finally got a table, ate and paid for our meals(mine was $80), we were asked to leave unless we were going to buy more food and drinks.  Our food and glasses were not cleared from the table until we were about to leave(people were told at the bar that there was a shortage of pint glasses, we had about 10 empty ones on our table for an hour and a half).  A member of our group asked to buy nachos and the waitress replied that she would need to figure out what was going on with our group before she could bring anything more for us lol.

LrBukmiQ4IOIbwyCMZZ0WQ.text: The staff is super nice and awesome.   We got there and checked in 7:52 was told an hour wait.   Came back at 8:30 then Waited till 9:20 to ask.  I know these times because I always wrestle with bothering the staff to "check my time".  The person at the front never said why we weren't texted and offered us a seat al.ost i.mediatly  A spot opened at the bar while I was talking at the front, so we took it.  Ordered around 9:35 or so(time less accurate due to beer while waiting). We ordered apps, we were served around  10:15 or so.  I posted a negative Yelp review and was offered a comped meal.   We're they related?   Not sure.  The food was good, I MAY have drunk yelped(yelp is a verb right?) because I was a little annoyed.  I get it, things happen and our server was great.  I asked that our food not be comped, and they still gave it to is half off.  I take reviews pretty seriously when looking at services, therefore I try to review fairly.  I dont write negative reviews to get a call or email from the manager.   I really want others to know how I felt.   It may be naive, but I want good services because that's what the establishment offers not because their yelp raiting will go down.   I say if you have the time, give this place a chance, prove me wrong.   Why not?

BDUasgr5lcHgTArOo_1Tjg.text: Have visited City Works several times. Love the bar atmosphere and numerous beers on tap! Fun place to catch a football game with all the big screen TVs. In my experience, the service is not always the fastest or friendliest, but I thoroughly enjoy their bar menu and all of their appetizers are delicious- we really enjoy the pretzel bites & buffalo shrimp.

3RPE5aV89pXeRLPS36IqEg.text: In the city for a labor conference, went to PGC park to check out the eating places. Decided to give City Works a try. I'm not normally a big fan of food in sports bars, but I must admit I was pleasantly impressed. Even though the service was a little slow, the food was excellent, the presentation was very appealing. I thought the service was good but could have been better. I would recommend this place, but I'd encourage their management to really up the service some.

9x0WfzurZFWinMl7q5zDag.text: 1st time here and I liked it. In the heart of busy Market Square. We're getting kinda old so finding a good place to meet friends gets a little harder as time goes on :) There were families with kids, bachelorette parties, couples, small groups. Plenty of seating inside and out. The place is bright and just a little loud, but not so much that you can't talk.  The beer list was extensive but has short descriptions of all the beers including alcohol content - a lot of interesting local brews. Also was nice that they offer a 6oz pour for all beers, so you can try some different ones without committing to a full glass.  Food was nothing amazing, but it was good. Service was excellent- our server as well as other waitstaff were all very friendly and interacted well with customers.  Overall we all enjoyed this place a lot. Will definitely return.

05fIRbc1v0p6GY3UPLjoCA.text: City Works has a nice atmosphere with massive TVs all around the restaurant, perfect for watching sports games. They're on the pricey side, which is why I usually only come here during happy hour for $4 apps and $4 beers/half off wine. I do wish they had more specials because I would come here more often during football and hockey season.

2ITa41D1BjNcB8yab-dkYQ.text: Best burger ever. Cityworks burger beat them all. It was short rib meat made into a patty. So delicious. Our table was by the sidewalk which offered great people-watching and the service was excellent. I'll remember that burger for a long time.

Fo6XGM-TWXbSs46DCWjBaw.text: I really like the atmosphere of this place. The beer and drink selection is great, and I have always enjoyed the food! There is always a good crowd of people there, but the wait has never been too bad. I was just there for dinner the other evening and had the chicken tacos- they were pretty good-but I previously had the barbecue chicken salad-and would def recommend that! Despite it being crowded and our server being pretty miserable, the food and drinks were all served pretty quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8sK3xqY5mPW2hjxyWic0Dw.text: Our first time in Pittsburgh, just stepped off the plane and decided to venture down to the Market Square on recommendation to try this place.  Friday...in Pittsburgh...lunchtime = everyone is out eating!  The place was packed but we actually got seated in good timing.  The waiter was attentive and ready for our orders.  The ambiance is awesome, with tables all over, plenty of tvs and lots of excitement going on.  We are soft pretzel fanatics so we started with those, which was great paired with their cheese dip.  I had their signature chicken sandwich with fries while my hubby had their house burger and both were delicious.  We never make it to dessert, especially if we get an appetizer, but some of them we saw being brought out looked delicious.  They have a ton of beer so be ready to browse the boards and pick a few out.  My hubby loves getting flights because you get options instead of having to pick just one and he enjoyed all that he got with his flight.  I would highly recommend checking this place out if in the area.  You won't be disappointed.

qeO6Hl8UZdRE5XeqwnvrcQ.text: I really want to like this place because they have a great location and a sweet TV set up and a great open concept but every time I go I'm always disappointed. The service is consistently below satisfactory and the quality of the food never matches how much my bill is at the end of the meal. My friends and I know better than to just put one drink order in at a time because if you only order one you won't see your waitress/waiter for awhile.

3sjZgXfHwFoVBhsW6J75Kw.text: City Works is fine--nothing special, but not terrible. We went on a Wednesday night; it wasn't too busy. But it took a very long time for our food to come out. I don't know if that's normal.   They've got an extensive beer menu and some large TVs, which is probably the main draw for coming here. And there's lots of hotels around, so it seems like a "safe" choice for picky eaters or people who want something more traditional.   I wouldn't come back since there are plenty of other places downtown that I'd prefer. But this place isn't bad.

q0mT2WUVQPeHVDdkiqAXMA.text: I absolutely LOVED the salmon! Aside from the awesome presentation it was cooked perfectly. So many great beers on tap. The bartenders were friendly & helpful in trying to give recommendations! I highly recommend this place! Can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon with butternut squash purée, fingerling potatoes, &amp; roasted veggies

oOZ7c1SieVoZgKOpWMWuCg.text: C We arrived at Market Square just in time for the Weekend vendor fair. The TV's were the draw for the guys in the group.  All sizes and shapes.. seen from the street.  We arrived around 9:30 and had a short wait.  We were greeted warmly and our name and cell phone number taken to be paged.  The wait was less than originally stated. Yay.  It was busy though.  Our party ordered chopped salad, pulled pork and wings.  The serving size is large and the wings and sauces were definitely the standout.  They have valet parking in the area for $10.00 which definitely helps.  They have lots of craft beer available but we opted for prosecco.  I definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside

k9xoTdC5JP77NvHNB2BpHQ.text: The service here consistently sucks. There seems to be a communication problem between host staff and wait staff, or else the wait staff is just oblivious. Every time I come in, it takes the server 10-20 minutes to come to my table and greet me. The past two or three times I was in, I was also charged incorrectly. One time they did not honor happy hour pricing even though my order was definitely placed during happy hour and most recently, they gave me a full beaker of wine when I had ordered the half. I didn't realize it was a full beaker until I had received the check and by then, the wine had been drank, do I didn't bother to point it out.  I spent many years of my life in front of house of restaurants, so it kills me to see an entire section of tables needing attention (some need their orders taken, some need their payment taken, some need plates removed, some need refills) while the server is MIA for more than 10-20 minutes at a time.  The only reason I go here is to sit outside,  work and people watch when it's nice out.

r4fYgZtrrT3fS226j99ztA.text: Great staff and epic beer selection BUT I had to only give 1 stars because despite the fact that they had an endless wall of taps they did not have Iron City Beer. Just leaving this one star so management hopefully sees it, how in the world can you have a sports bar in downtown Pittsburgh that promotes beer and not serve an iconic Pittsburgh beer?!?!  Location is nice, very cool looking place, solid food, good bathrooms and awesome staff, management just needs to wake up...

bcxc9SNcBAShnFkXlSN44Q.text: Went to CW yesterday.  Got in before the Pride Day parade finished but they were still busy.  The restaurant didn't staff appropriately considering the parade and the Arts Festival.  Getting drinks took a long time and 1 person in our group got the wrong order.  Food was tasty, but again a bit slow out of the kitchen.  Not a bad restaurant, but the copper table tops make your hands smell.  Overall, average especially considering it was $70 for 2 people.

zw5VeBySCBmvxf_c8C5iig.text: Came here for the drinks, and ended up sharing 4 appetizers with my friends. We were very impressed by the food... the buffalo shrimp and the short rib tacos have me drooling just thinking about them. Cool interior seating and nice outdoor patio...overall great vibe and had great service there too. But I repeat, get the short rib tacos!!

NAEtvJPYemSa-gTVeOmERQ.text: Great ambience, wonderful to be sitting at the bar in full sunlight! The City Works burger was fantastic, and the bartender, Lauren was prompt with service and super friendly. Randomly walked into this place looking for lunch and a few beers - it checked the boxes perfectly.  Heartily recommend.

SuKJhHpmpHOHv1J9cnYePQ.text: Stopped by here before a baseball game and will definitely be back! We had time to kill so we thought we'd stop for a beer. Because it was a weekend, it was very full. We were told it would be a wait for a table but that was ok with us. Upon being seated, we had a very friendly server (I wish I could remember his name because he was awesome) gave us great suggestions and really made sure to check on us. Overall delicious food and amazing tap selection

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Firecracker Rolls

tW3f5u_r_oKdrcEgq2IbmA.text: Came here on the recommendation of a friend for some food and to watch a game.   Arrived shortly before 9pm.  Waited for about 5 mins just for the hostess to show up.  Then waited another 10 mins just to get acknowledged by a server.     By the time we got to place a food order, the kitchen had shifted from their regular menu to a "late night" menu of 7 items (mostly appetizer style, and a burger, or a slider).   Had to step away from our table and go to the bar to order a beer, because our server never brought ours.   Didn't get the iced tea and original beer order until the food came.    Food came cold and warm (ordered a burger, pretzel bites, smoked wings, and buffalo chicken dip).  Food was average, but didn't get any utensils or napkins. Asked for them a few times before walking up to the bar to grab our own sets.     Never got a refill on the iced tea.  Walked up to the bar again for another round of beer.  When it came to close out the check, got no pen.    The place was a complete mess.   One busser spilled ranch on the floor (on accident).  Almost the entire staff walked by it, but nobody cleaned it.  Amazing nobody slipped and broke their neck.   The place was about full, with two games in, and we got last call at 10:30pm because "managements said so" - and even though their have closing time advertised as 12:00am.    Pretty surreal how bad everything was.   Aside from the fact that nobody cared, nobody even noticed.  It was just business as usual.  Pretty scary... and incredible this place is still in business. Would not recommend, and not coming back - as there were many other nice places in town.

1dU_5kQS4nHaXDYcRZelqA.text: The service was garbage. Sat for over 10 minutes in the non crowed bar area and no one helped. We walked out and the hostess just shrugged us off. Not a good experience.

jMaa0l5cVWBEGv-nfF8DLg.text: Ehhhhh....I feel bad because I loved the atmosphere and our waitress was really friendly but the service just wasn't good. I don't know what was going on but it was just extremely slow...it took about 15 minutes to get a glass of water and we went past 8:30 when there wasn't a large crowd. The food took a long time to come out as well, which wouldn't be a big deal if it had just gotten done being cooked but everything was pretty cold and limp. I'm not picky and neither are my coworkers, but we ended up paying for uneaten shrimp, limp fries, and cold fish.

MQC-gL9We1HhXHTr0KuGLA.text: We decided to eat at Market Square before the Steelers game and City Works caught our eye. It looks AWESOME from the sidewalk! An entire wall of huge TV's and a large bar with 90 beers on tap! It's a sports lovers dream come True... or so we thought.   We expected to have a long wait on Sunday because downtown was so busy with people coming in early for the football game and shopping at the Christmas Village in Market Square. We gave ourselves about four and a half hours before kick off. City Works wouldn't give out a wait time, but put us on the list to text us when our table (for two) was ready. We walked around for over an hour without receiving a text and decided to go back and check the list. As we approached we could see at least 7 empty booths and several empty tables. I walked in and asked where we were on the list and they never checked, just immediately sat us in a booth. I have nooooo idea why they were taking names/numbers and not texting anyone when tables became available. I'm sure they lost A LOT of business.  The place was soooo filthy. I was giving them a pass, because it was truly packed an hour earlier and I figured they just hadn't had an opportunity to clean up after the dinner rush. WRONG. I watched the hostess continuously brush every crumb and napkin on the ground as she gave no effort into brushing off tables and no one ever attempted to clean up the floor. The people in the booth beside us still had lettuce on their table when they sat down and complained. It was really bad.  We each ordered a beer and meals. They were out of both the beer and dinner that my boyfriend ordered. So he really struck out. He did land on a backup beer and a burger, while I ordered the fish tacos. It took about an hour for our food to come out, despite the place clearing out substantially. Our waitress was really great. She was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. However, she couldn't make up for the slow kitchen or how over priced the food was. Don't get me wrong the food was okay, just not $65 dinner-for-two good. There are easily 100 other options in the city with a similar price point and better quality food.   City Works really needs someone to come in and fix the front house issues. There is no excuse for not seating the people you put on your list when it's 1/4 empty or having filthy(!!!) tables and floors. We're sports bar people and this completely missed the mark. It's trying way too hard to be a sports bar with higher end food, but the food here isn't worth what you're paying for.   I recommend maybe grabbing a drink here, but eating elsewhere.

vHpQyQWgTcv9CMtvoEDlcA.text: It's just ok. Ok service, ok in decor. It was a busy Friday night and the service was simply slow. Our waiter jake was nice but needed extra hands to help him out. The cheese curds were alright, nothing to rave about. The veggie burger was fine. The beer selection is nice, best part of the bar.   It's location is great, very central. Come here for a drink not for the food.

I-ezOQKpN7XknX-m-LcUKw.text: We have been to city works a few times and always enjoy yourselves. The food is over priced for the portions that you receive. The beer and drink selection is vast and all the reason to come. The atmosphere can be loud but what do you expect from a wildly open concept sports bar?  There are plenty of TV's to catch all the games! I've always found it to be clean to include the bathrooms.   Ask for the waiter Ryan. He is attentive, quick, funny, and probably the best staff that we have ever had at any restaurant.   Four stars because the food is over priced for the portions. Plus the food is not high end. It's traditional American food.

p_7UaSjXUJbLmvR4k0vbqQ.text: Came here on a Friday night and the place was busy but was seated right away. I ordered the scorpion burger and I very disappointed. The burger very spicy and had no other flavor development. And yes I know the burger is suppose to be spicy but just putting raw jalapenos on a dry burger is not very good. The fries were also very soggy. My friend ordered the chicken tinga tacos and the were actually pretty good. The only saving grace about this place in my opinion were the drinks which were very good and drink selections which was very large!

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Tinga Taco
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scorpion Burger

d9gQ0AzEexYf3RQ8OcOIGg.text: For some odd reason, I couldn't remember why I was so "eh" about this place. At first glance, a place that touts itself as being a sports bar with a large craft beer menu always calls my name. As soon as I clicked to go to the business page, I found my friend's review that flipped the lightbulb immediately on why I feel the way I do about City Works.  My friend and I arrived about an hour and a half before the game to grab a drink and a light snack. While there were no seats at the bar, we were sat immediately at the end of a long table in the bar area. Our server came around and quickly grabbed our drink orders. We wanted to split an app, and she recommended the goat cheese flatbread. Our beers came quick and the flatbread followed soon after. It was fabulous!  After we received our flatbread, our waitress was nowhere to be found. We wanted another round before we headed off to the game, and although we placed the drink order quickly, it took nearly a half hour for the drinks to arrive. The time spent made us late to the game, and we couldn't even find our server within that time period to tell her never mind. The drinks are also on the expensive side. I purposely chose an 11% beer so I would feel like I was getting my money's worth. (Side note: bad idea.) They did hold onto my credit card, which I greatly appreciate.  I probably would have given 4 stars if my server was a little more present. Maybe I just received the short end of the stick. The food I received was delicious. If asked, I wouldn't rule out trying here again, but with Pittsburgh being a growing food & alcohol scene, they didn't wow me enough to prioritize going there again before trying somewhere new.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flatbread
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

z130qebUc2jKABh2hsQuIg.text: The food is okay. It was tasty but everything we had was extremely salty! And I like salt..They have a decent beer selection and the ambience is nice. The service was pretty slow though. Given your options for happy hour downtown this is one of the better places, but still not worth going out of your way for.

hGKJRxiuz7MH_ZfbgFYywg.text: Preface: I am in the service industry myself. If you give me even average service, I will at least tip 25-30%.   City Works is a fantastic place IF you like to play hide and seek with your waitress. If you want food, or even a beer in less than 30 minutes, you should look else where.  We sat down in the outside area on a Sunday. Including us, there were probably 20 people total in the entire restaurant. After 10 minutes, a waitress appeared. We asked a simple question about an appetizer, which overwhelmed her. We gave her the benefit of the doubt, and just ordered a beer. A simple draft beer.   Twenty five min passed.  I walked indoors, asking if anyone could get us water, beer, whatever. Embarrassed, the hostess said she'll send her right back out.  Five more minutes passed (we were her only table).  We calmly got up, and left.   Summary? Maybe this place has good food? Possible, but we never got past getting poured a glass of water, much less a beer.   We went across to diamond grill, ate, drank, and paid my bill before that waitress ever came back lol. ::Facepalm::   Just don't even come here. Don't.

jiJ1o4wxLLDsnNvvLLl3Ug.text: City Works has superb service and absolutely fantastic service.  The venue itself is uncomfortable. I feel like I'm in a hotel lobby. There is just something about it that feels disconcerting.  The beer selection is huge. Plenty of beer options.  The food selection is standard bar food. Think Cheesecake Factory. They make good food, it just lacks soul.  This is a safe and reliable choice for someone picky or a large group. Not for foodies or hipsters.

HsOCtxGo_Mf5ZGHMtP357Q.text: I really really liked City Works! We came here over Memorial Day weekend on a whim and it turned out to be a great place! Since it was so nice out, we sat on the patio which is a great location for people watching in Market Square. The inside of the restaurant also looked really nice and spacious.   For drinks, I started with the basil lemonade. It was so pretty when she served it to me with a huge basil leaf! The taste of it was just OK for me- I couldn't really even taste the basil! We also ordered an app off the "Bar Bites" section of the menu- which I think just means they are smaller. Both Chris and I were swooning over the firecracker rolls! They were in an egg roll wrapper with spicy chicken and veggies inside and topped off with an avocado cream sauce. Seriously amazing! For our entrees, we both ended up ordering the fish tacos. It came with 3 breaded mahi-mahi fish tacos and chips and salsa. These were also amazing! I typically order grilled fish tacos so it was a nice change from my usual order.   The only reason City Works didn't receive a 5 star for me is because of service. Our waitress wasn't very attentive to us so we didn't even end up ordering a second drink! Hopefully on our next visit (which there will be one!) we will receive better service.

dlTNvdVC4R1sJAtpJ81XtQ.text: This was my first visit at City Works and the layout is great. We had a party of 12 so they provided us with a private dining room in the front of the restaurant. Ryan our server was great with the exception of he disappeared for some time and we had to request that someone got him for us. The food was okay. I had the firecracker rolls and fish tacos. If you don't like spicy stay away from both. The slaw on the tacos were way to spicy for me and I found myself digging the filling out f the rolls and eating the shell with the wonderful avocado sauce. I would go back again and try some other food. The fries were great

mG70mGy-UWpBvUT2pI1gSA.text: We are visiting from Annapolis and chose to come here for dinner. We were not disappointed. Jill was or waitress and even though the place was packed we received great customer service. I had the fish and chips and my husband had the fish tacos. Both dishes were great.   Would be a great place to come with a group of people to watch a game, drink and have some tasty food.

T72Z486wW2RmmtsI5Otlpw.text: This is the second time I ate here. I won't count the first one as it was opening weekend and places usually need time to figure things out.  However this time was not much better. The staff was nice enough however the food leaves much to be desired. I ordered the Grilled Chicken sandwich. With my first bite I realized it was cold. I asked the server if it was supposed to be cold and she said no. It wasn't warm at all. I opened the sandwich and it is clear that the chicken is not actually grilled, but was precooked and just thrown on the grill to get some dirty grill marks. I will post the pic if I can. Anyone who has ever grilled a piece of chicken knows what it should look like. The server offered to have the kitchen prepare a new sandwich for me but I did not have time to wait because I had to get back to work. Fortunately they took it off if the bill, but still... I did not try my girlfriend's burger, but she was not impressed with it.  Overall a disappointing meal with overpriced drinks. It's sad that this is what is happening all over Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Just white chicken with dirty grill marks.

nVEd3uVW0uRyUJF9YgD16Q.text: Two times in a row- cold food, wrong order, and now pieces of broken plate in the food. We gave it a second chance but it was terrible again. Great server but something with management needs changed.

vltdtKSMZYyr03QpXSJPHg.text: Beer is great, however a great beer selection won't make up for bad flavorless food. Food is pretty terrible.  My date had a chicken sandwich the bun was old and top was rock hard the bottom was soggy.  The floors are like an ice rink. I'll never eat here again.

Zhu1HXOFxFEinSPnkzB8tA.text: 7 of us met here on Sunday evening at 7:30. It was Steeler home game day (1:00 game), so we were hoping it wasn't too busy. It wasn't terrible, so we decided to wait for a table. As we were being seated we were given the late night menu...it was only 8:00. The hostess said they had to switch to that menu because they ran out of everything. And of the limited list of food on the menu, they ran out of half of that, too. Really??!  Our waiter comes over, super nice guy, and apologized for the limited menu but said they were crushed on Saturday for the Pitt homecoming game, and then the Sunday Steeler game. Did the management not know how to plan for a busy weekend??? OK, so we order what we can since it was getting late and we just wanted to eat. The food took FOREVER and was not good. The Nashville Hot Chicken sandwich was so doused in hot sauce it wasn't edible (and this is a crew that loves hot and spicy); the filet sliders were OK, but looked liked they were cooked the day before, and the burger I ordered didn't come out until everyone was done and we were getting ready to leave. We asked to see the manager, who was a really nice guy and very apologetic, and he was nice enough to pick up the tab for our entire bill. Sorry, great atmosphere and location, but we won't ever be back. This place needs to seriously get their act together.

czvayLvlqTqznt5LENVgSg.text: Stopped in for a drink with a family member. We waited forever for a drink, $11 a piece, which tasted watered down. One sip, and already having been waiting for a long time, decided we didn't want to stay. The food may be spectacular, but for somewhere not busy and with such an expansive bar you expect better drinks and faster service. Especially in Pittsburgh. A lot of employees stood around due to not being busy. Paid for the one drink, cancelled our appetizer, and left. Totally disappointing. Worst $11 I've ever spent, honestly.  Also, tried to order a drink and they were out of the liquor on a Friday... don't recommend a drink if you don't have it! Also, who doesn't stock their bar in time for Friday?

6Ud1xgPb-r89IwrmIZJT9A.text: GET THE PRETZELS AND BEER CHEESE. AND THEN GET MORE BEER CHEESE.   Ok...now that's out of the way... I've had lunch here a few times and would definitely recommend it! It's a HUGE place in Market Square, so I imagine there are not many times throughout the day that you'd have much of a wait to get seated.  I've had a few dishes here. For the apps, I'd definitely recommend the pretzels and beer cheese, as previously stated, as well as the friend pickles. I've had the Peppercorn burger and the Fried Chicken sandwich and was very happy with both. You can easily get a great lunch for around $15.  During my latest visit, our server was Demond and he was an absolute joy! We were seated in one of the private rooms near the bar and he was extremely attentive throughout our entire meal. The manager, Bobby, even came out to check on us and make sure everything was OK. Our service was marvelous, especially for it being such a busy place. Thanks, Demond & Bobby!

bItPLyITmSL57ysJAzftxg.text: Downtown definitely needed a place like this- tons of huge televisions make it perfect to watch a sports game and they had over 50 beers on tap! We visited on a Wednesday for some late night drinks and snacks. Most of their beers are written on the menu and on their large drink board, however there were some seasonals that were not listed. I had to ask two servers what the seasonal beers were and neither of them knew without having to go to the bar to ask. I hate to be picky, but I do think that a place that wants to specialize in beer should ensure their servers at least have the seasonal beers written down somewhere so they can ask simple questions like that. Otherwise, the servers were pleasant and provided great service. I ended up choosing Space Dust by Elysian Brewing, which is always a good choice. For snacks, we went with the buffalo chicken dip and bier cheese and pretzels off of the late night menu. They were both very good, although some chicken pieces in the dip were much too big to eat with a chip. I guess that proves it's house made though, which is a good thing. The bathrooms were pretty gross, as a side note. Overall, I would return for a game and to check out their dinner menu. Hoping I am more impressed when I come back!

TSM3G8Za6vsDP5fSbo9NbQ.text: Glorified food court vibe.  Expensive apps and shareables that are hardly for sharing with a group. Food was lackluster. Only 1 of the 4 of us at my table were pleased. Only saving grace is the extensive draft list, though overall value considered, you'd be much better off heading to a local brewery and getting food elsewhere.

2mVKo1ujuBSqnMQA01i1Qg.text: Break down of my experience here:  90+ beers on tap!  Huge televisions!  Ridiculously good and strangely enough evenly "topping-ed" duck nachos!!  Superb location in the middle of Market Square.  This place was absolutely great! I have found my new go-to bar for sporting events and a delicious meal with great beer! Good thing they have a rewards program too, bc I am already a frequent flier and it has only been open for 1 month!

kROk8yhXm1lkWzOrTQlevA.text: Guys, I am so torn. The location is perfect, the vibe is just right, the presentation is great. You know what isn't as awesome? The food. Mediocre at best, Id say. I've had the salads and a few the the appetizers. For instance the chicken is bland, the fried pickles aren't battered and breaded before frying, the cheese for the pretzel bites is watery.  The draft selection is vast but I am not a beer drinker so it does not appeal to me. The drinks are pretty good but I wouldn't order anything twice. Hoping the potential only soars from here and the food is more thoughtfully crafted.

32WjIbfh7ZCwWIqjV5AcVg.text: I was in Pittsburgh visiting my cousin and going to the Pirates game, so our big group came to City Works to drink and eat before. We were not disappointed! The beer list alone is a great reason to stop here as they have over 70 beers on tap. The buffalo chicken dip and crab dip were outstanding as were the cheese curds. I had a wedge which was good, your standard wedge salad. Other people said that the burgers they had were amazing as was the fried chicken sandwich. Service was above and beyond great as well. The only complaint is that we asked to keep three separate checks in our big group and the waitress didn't accommodate that. It created a bit of mayhem (mostly because some in our party are cheapskates). Otherwise, great meal and great atmosphere!

7hoTO4EU4Vcd1F4ydYz75Q.text: I had the buffalo shrimp app and the salmon entree. The shrimp was fried and dipped in a buffalo sauce. The sauce was not to spicy.  The salmon was very buttery. The whole dish was extremely buttery. Wayyy to much butter. Whoever was cooking thought they were Paula Deen lol

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo shrimp

QhDdSpGZbshzOiiWgH8GlQ.text: Atmosphere is fun, great beer selection (although, Bells Oberon would be appreciated).    This was probably my 4th or 5th time here.  Food is mediocre and the service mediocre at best.  HOWEVER, tonight we had a great server, DEMOND, who can be solely responsible for my ever giving this restaurant another chance.

Pt7-hPdgesUmwODhd54gmg.text: Great beer selection. Expensive for small pours. Bartenders with horrible social skills.

bq6hRXvxKdUKzarmvfQoVA.text: DUCK NACHOS. Enough said.  Those wonton chips are amazing and the proportions of each ingredient (shredded duck, cheese, salsa, etc).  They were on point and when we tried to get more they had run out.  We also had the buffalo shrimp, and wings.  We also ordered some short rib tacos (filling was delicious, tortilla was okay).  Our friends ordered the short rib burger which I have a bite of and it was delicious!   But like I said before- all about the duck nachos.  They have a good beer selection and it is very spacious inside.  Outside seating is great but not as large so going back I'd try to make a reservation or get there early.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck nachos
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked Wings
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Shrimp

WGeVi3l9uyfPapAOhYE2Hg.text: I like this bar a lot! It's in market square and has outdoor seating. If you can't find a seat outside there's ample indoor space therefore waiting should not be an issue on a normal night. We were there on a Saturday night and the bar was host to a post wedding soiree .   It's reasonably priced. We had two cocktails and firecracker rolls. The total was $27. I thought the firecracker rolls were pretty good, they are super spicy and I was not prepared for that.   They offered a late night menu which we ordered from; the menu offerings address most dietary needs and are unique enough to be remembered the next day. These include :   Pretzel Bites *V  Firecracker Rolls Popcorn Chicken Kung Pow Cauliflower   And they offer a burger  for your late night meat craving.   You won't be disappointed by their beer offerings as they have 90 beers on tap and assorted wines, as well as cocktails.   Tip: they serve water at request only

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Low carb cocktail

fruRpTmm12qde5m9wiSH3g.text: Stoped I'm on a whim. Pretty cool open space. Sat outside which is nice to do in Market Square.  On the good- Beer selection  On the great - Food. Had the Tuna tacos and had the fish tacos. (Split with my wife) Amazing flavors. Excellent!  Good value.   On the ok was the staff. It seemed like it was killing our hostess to smile. None of the wait staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  Our waiter was very nice and friendly, but the service was slow. For me, I go out for the experience, not just food. I would go back because the food is that good, I just won't expect a pleasant experience. Shame...3-1/2 stars because it's better than average, could be amazing.

hL0EqyNan4a-SRdlDS-S6Q.text: I was looking for some place to get dinner quite late, post 10pm and there were so few options. Almost all the dining places were closed, but luckily I came across City Works. This place is lively, and seemed like a good place to eat and drink. I do not know much about the parking situation as I just walked from my hotel to this place. I did see a bit of street parking around. The drinks were good. I loved my Cranberry Mojito. The appetizers were really tasty, especially the pretzel bites. For a late night grub, this place definitely gets my vote in downtown Pittsburgh's best places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. City Works Burger
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretzel bites
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken dip

IFcX6b-J6EbajLRScr9Icg.text: Stopped by on vacation and let me say, service here is the worst I've ever experienced in my entire life. I didn't even know my servers name because he never introduced himself, and he was talking to us like he didn't  even want to be here. Coming off rude and unpleasant is definitely not the way to go in the restaurant business. It was not even busy and my food came out missing my fries and nobody here with a sense of urgency. My fries tasted okay but they would've tasted a lot better if they came out with my chicken sandwich. If you're thinking about coming here DON'T. If you're going to act like you don't want to work here, then don't work here at all.

9E604dthGV5RcKHn6epM2w.text: It looked like a generic beer joint w/ food but then blew my socks off with the awesome cauliflower steak, served with a small arugula salad on top and romenesco sauce. I've got many vegetarian friends who complain about the uninspired offerings for their ilk, so would definitely direct them here. The place is flat-ass packed through the lunch hour, so time yourself accordingly!

O-km7jWOwxLsCfBxgpcZeA.text: I'm not very impressed with this place other than the large beer selection they have. The service is super slow and the food is average at best and extremely overpriced. It's a fun atmosphere though. A great place to have a couple drinks and watch some sports games. They have outdoor seating as well so it seems like a popular place in the summer. Lately when I've been here, it has been mostly empty which makes me think others are over the high prices as well. The location is awesome if you are spending a day in the city but I would say don't waste your time coming here if it is the only reason you're coming into the city. The fish tacos weren't that bad though. I would get them again if I go back but I think there are many better options in the area with less expensive food than City Works.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos

1uQIExRB6BW3AiZ96xqbag.text: Busy, spacious bar in Market Square in downtown Pittsburgh. Bustling, happening place around lunch on a work day. Standard pub fare at standard prices. Good for groups given their open layout and large, high tables.  I got a really interesting cauliflower steak dish. It was basically a large, steak-shaped piece of cauliflower with greens and peppers on top and some sauce. Nice healthy, vegetarian option at a pub with an otherwise meat-heavy menu. Tasty although the flavoring could have been stronger. My girlfriend got the sirloin sliders, which were slider sizes and shaped but had steak in them rather than burgers. Nice twist on the usual arrangement. Sirloin is good but a whole steak is sometimes too much so the sliders were a good size. Came with fries which were average.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cauliflower steak

hJTBB3YVCahfSgfiY2bvnQ.text: I enjoy going to this spot with my fiance. He loves all the big screens and I love all the drink selections...win/win! I always get the wings. Every time. Sad that the bread pudding isn't on the menu anymore though

83XEc46RvY_RUeB5uKA3Sg.text: Group of friends and I walked into here on a busy Saturday afternoon and surprisingly were seated right away. Wish we had turned around earlier and went somewhere else as we were really looking for some good food.   So, first off, this place needs to definitely step their game up with customer service. We saw our waiter maybe 2-3 times during our entire two hours at the restaurant... that is ridiculous. We would never be able to located him when we needed something for the table so had to end up asking a different employee every time. I would only recommend this place just because they have close to 100 beers on tap but other than that, the food is below average bar food. I had gotten the veggie burger (not on the menu as the impossible burger was out of stock so this was the temporary replacement). It was one of the worst veggie burgers I ever had; very bland and no sauces in the burger. We had gotten cheese curds for the table (very greasy) but my friends did enjoy their wings and baked mac and cheese.   On top of all this, I noticed a couple days later that they had overcharged me by $10. I called and they said it was probably just a mistake and they refunded me the difference. There are a lot of other restaurants in this area with much better food. If you want a quick craft beer this is the place to go, if not go visit elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Burger
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheese Curds
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baked Mac and Cheese

EP3-gXzh644mg1kbj9tpww.text: Stopped here for dinner. Good spot for any group of people. Large space and a large draft menu. I ordered a nice fruit beer that I actually enjoyed two of. I got the tacos, which were tasty. I also tried one of my colleagues nachos was good, they were a wanton type nacho. The service was quite slow, which was the drawback. Okay place to go, but probably not the best recommendation.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos
Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken wing dip

jKzcDrI_Mb3TDJbjIeJ6Qw.text: My husband and I were looking somewhere to go to dinner for our anniversary. We like casual and this place seemed like a nice in between. It felt very upscale but had a "normal" menu.  We spotted this while strolling through the square and the atmosphere and esthetic sold us. It's so beautiful inside, and has a beautiful patio. We opted for the patio and it was the perfect romantic spot. My husband got the ribs and I got the salmon - SO delicious. We got the Nashville Hot Popcorn Chicken as our app and it was delicious.  The prices are affordable but the feel of the restaurant makes you feel more upscale. Great service. Great food. They claimed to make everything fresh and from scratch and I could definitely tell - everything tasted amazing. We would recommend!! I'm going to post some updated menu pics since the ones on here are no longer accurate!

N8hRjT4ZZhJtRIHYcV6oHg.text: Great selection of beers and drinks and our server was great. However, the food was not impressive at all, especially for the price. Small portions and even the dishes we thought were going to be creative seemed generic and...blah. I'm not sure if this is a chain or not but it felt very "chain-y" or "corporate" and quite expensive for not quality food.

FcQtdCsJkcIwUWtkFqOXUQ.text: Located in Market Square. Very new and clean facility with lots of open space so you don't feel crowded at your table. Lots of beer options as well as apps, salads and entrees. Small children's menu available as well. We got seated right away on a Sunday around Noon. We attempted to get a table for 4 a couple weeks ago on a Saturday night and the wait was 1.5 hours so I strongly recommend a reservation if you plan to go at a peak time. Lots of TVs all around the restaurant.   The Buffalo Shrimp app was very good but with only 5 shrimp for $14 dollars, I was disappointed.  I don't eat meat so was cautiously excited to try the Impossible Burger! It was delicious! The side salad that it came with as a sub for fries was however, the smallest side salad I've ever seen. Considering it was only lettuce, cucumbers and tomatoes, I'm not sure why it was so tiny. I also think our food sat for a little while before coming out since it was a little cold. They also forgot one of our parties orders completely.  Overall, my food was good and the atmosphere was nice. However, the service wasn't fabulous, the food only sort of fresh and I thought the prices a little high. I can see why the overall rating right now is 3/5. I'd definitely come back though because it was overall good but I might prefer trying another new place first.

1HcOCV01eTOVlwKXJ6Sq6A.text: City Works is a big, open restaurant in market square that that has a lot of beer options and large TV's.  I have been for both lunch and dinner.  Most recently I got the ahi tuna salad.  The tuna was quite good.  Overall the salad was ok, but it felt like it was missing something.  Maybe cheese or nuts.  It fell short of being great, but it was a good healthier option.

AXMQM3C1n8LcgJKvPmLWZg.text: The food was ok but the service was awful.  Our server Madelyn took our drink order and brought it.  Then took the food order and did not come back. We had to ask where our food was 45 minutes later.  After eating we called her over and asked for the bill. Of course she did not bring it. When asked again for it her comment was    Do you have some where to be !!   We had 2 small children that was over done with waiting   We will not be back !!!!

96309Kg8kfNyvNtQg5YWcA.text: We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here at city works as this was the 1st bar we walked into pregame for the Steelers game . Bar staff very welcoming and knowledgeable about the beers on tap. Being from out of town was very helpful in directing us to a few places around the city which was very, very helpful for us out of towners. So thanks guys and shout out to you for making feel happy in your city. Oh yea them Duck Nachos were my FAVORITE hands down . Tricked my sister into believing it was chicken needless to say she at the whole thing with me . Wong ton chips makes it go !!

9n-SfEo43Xvd8OfPo4DMPg.text: Ok, this is going to be a very mixed review; I'm going to split it in two sections and explain my poor rating. I legitimately feel bad about giving one star, but, I hope all that read understand why.  I seek to write honest and forthright reviews based on my personal experiences without outside influence.  On that note, I'm sorry to write this review.   I arrived with a party of six on "take your kid to work day" in the 'Burgh.  Here we go:  The Good: the food is pretty decent fair, but it does not warrant the prices.  But, that's ok, it's only a few bucks more than everyone else and offers a superior environment. The wait for food was exceptionally long, but, the restaurant solidly acknowledged that and discounted our food without request. I have to give them a lot of credit, it was incredibly kind and considerate of them to take care of us in such a manner. Kudos to their waitstaff and management.  Rarely will an establishment adjust a tab, without request, for the sole purpose of keeping patrons happy so they come back again. Very cool!  The Bad: When ordering, I explicitly stated that my six-year old son could not have cheese on his kid-burger as it would immediately be sent back. Well, it showed up with cheese. I get that, it happens. I used to serve tables too. It was sent back. When we received it back a few minutes later we realized that they had taken the burgers back and hand-scraped the cheese off of them.  Particles of cheese were duly noted by my kid and I.   You can't do that.   You cannot do that EVER.   RESPECT DIETARY REQUESTS; FAILURE TO DO SO CAN HURT PEOPLE  Food Safety Fail = 1 Star Rating

jyqXNKm3HIXyoHSThE3jZw.text: We came here on a Saturday night around 7pm. It wasn't too packed yet so we were able to get a table which was nice. Servers were polite. It's a large space with a ton of tvs to watch basically any sporting event going on. They have a huge beer list which was awesome as well. They have a decent menu, but to be honest, for the small amount of food we received, this place is way too overpriced. We ordered the mushroom flatbread and buffalo chicken dip to share. We also ordered a Caesar salad. The salad wasn't even cut and came out as huge leaves we had to cut ourselves which was kind of unusual. The flatbread was delicious I can say! I loved the goat cheese and truffle oil on it and I'm also not even a fan only mushrooms haha. The buffalo chicken dip was good but we both thought it was entirely too spicy. I also got a flight of beer and enjoyed the beer.

photos.caption: Photo of City Works - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mushroom flatbread, buff dip, Caesar salads

FLpzmRl3Z1qm_ECxqiqIeg.text: Nashville hot chicken wrap tasted like chili powder was just dumped on it - no actual flavor, just chili powder.  Bloody Mary was underwhelming (especially for $15) but lots of beers on tap to choose from.  Pluses: Atmosphere is nice for game day (lots of TVs) and the server was nice.

VY8f-Vy_Ws4LDIJtjIsNfg.text: I had a really delicious salad here for luch.  Since it was early in the day and very slow inside, it came out quickly.  I got the steak salad which was really good. The meat had a little fat that I needed to trim off which I feel like, in a salad, I shouldn't have to do, and it looked a little mangled, but it was still delicious.   They have a really amazing beer menu, and if I hadn't been going back to work, I probably would have tried a couple.    The reason I'm giving only 3 stars is because it's REALLY pricey for bar food.  I had a salad and water and after an average tip and taxes, my total was over $22.  Not sure I'd do that regularly.

l3ajWCndzUEZ2LFBhYk_mw.text: Had the duck rueben before and it was great. This time I ordered the duck nachos and I was amazed at the flavors! The duck actually tasted as though it was smoked. My buddy had the duck rueben and he was amazed. Service was great!
